title: Robot swarming applications

references.title: A generalized potential field approach to obstacle avoidance control.
Animal groups in three dimensions.
Behavior-based formation control for multirobot teams.
Current state of the art in multi-robot teams.
Flocks, herds, and schools: A distributed behavioral model.
Formations with a mission: Stable coordination of vehicle group maneuvers. In
From swarm intelligence to swarm robotics.
Modeling and control of formations of nonholonomic mobile robots.
Multi-robot systems: A classification focused on coordination.
Novel type of phase transition in a system of self-driven particles.
Numerical potential field techniques for robot path planning.
Olfactory coordinated mobile robot area coverage. Autonomous Robots Journal, Special Issue on Mobile Robot Olfaction,
Olfactory sensory system for odour-plume tracking and localization.
On the dynamics of clustering systems.

abstract: This paper discusses the different modes of operation of a swarm of robots: (i) non-communicative swarming, (ii) communicative swarming, (iii) networking, (iv) olfactory-based navigation and (v) assistive swarming. I briefly present the state of the art in swarming and outline the major techniques applied for each mode of operation and discuss the related problems and expected results
